refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Functions for manipulating Universal Resource Identifiers (URIs) as defined by RFC 3986. It is highly recommended that you have read and understand RFC 3986 for understanding this API. A copy of RFC 3986 can be found at .

refsect2.title: G_URI_RESERVED_CHARS_ALLOWED_IN_PATH
refsect2.para: Allowed characters in a path. Includes "!$&'()*+,;=:@/".

refsect2.title: G_URI_RESERVED_CHARS_ALLOWED_IN_PATH_ELEMENT
refsect2.para: Allowed characters in path elements. Includes "!$&'()*+,;=:@".

refsect2.title: G_URI_RESERVED_CHARS_ALLOWED_IN_USERINFO
refsect2.para: Allowed characters in userinfo as defined in RFC 3986. Includes "!$&'()*+,;=:".

refsect2.title: G_URI_RESERVED_CHARS_GENERIC_DELIMITERS
refsect2.para: Generic delimiters characters as defined in RFC 3986. Includes ":/?#[]@".

refsect2.title: G_URI_RESERVED_CHARS_SUBCOMPONENT_DELIMITERS
refsect2.para: Subcomponent delimiter characters as defined in RFC 3986. Includes "!$&'()*+,;=".

refsect2.title: g_uri_escape_string ()
refsect2.para: Escapes a string for use in a URI.

Normally all characters that are not "unreserved" (i.e. ASCII alphanumerical characters plus dash, dot, underscore and tilde) are escaped. But if you specify characters in reserved_chars_allowed they are not escaped. This is useful for the "reserved" characters in the URI specification, since those are allowed unescaped in some portions of a URI.

listitem.simpara: a string of reserved characters that are allowed to be used.
TRUE if the result can include UTF-8 characters.
an escaped version of unescaped. The returned string should be freed when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_uri_get_scheme ()
refsect2.para:
Gets the scheme portion of a URI. RFC 3986 decodes the scheme as:
URI = scheme ":" hier-part [ "?" query ] [ "#" fragment ]
Common schemes include "file", "http", "svn+ssh", etc.

listitem.simpara: The "Scheme" component of the URI, or NULL on error. The returned string should be freed when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_uri_unescape_segment ()
refsect2.para: Unescapes a segment of an escaped string.

If any of the characters in illegal_characters or the character zero appears as an escaped character in escaped_string then that is an error and NULL will be returned. This is useful it you want to avoid for instance having a slash being expanded in an escaped path element, which might confuse pathname handling.

listitem.simpara: an optional string of illegal characters not to be allowed.
an unescaped version of escaped_string or NULL on error. The returned string should be freed when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: g_uri_unescape_string ()
refsect2.para: If any of the characters in illegal_characters or the character zero appears as an escaped character in escaped_string then that is an error and NULL will be returned. This is useful it you want to avoid for instance having a slash being expanded in an escaped path element, which might confuse pathname handling.

listitem.simpara: an escaped string to be unescaped.
an optional string of illegal characters not to be allowed.
an unescaped version of escaped_string. The returned string should be freed when no longer needed.
